channel.title: 84 Server crashed
channel.description: The world crashed today. I remember someone saying that runescape has only crashed twice.

item.title: 84 Server crashed
item.dc:creator: @IlikeArrays IlikeArrays
item.description:
@IlikeArrays wrote:

“So we got about 175 million accounts, which of about 10 million are active on a monthly basis. People tend to dip and dip out month on month, they come back after a few years.”

About 20 percent of players pay.

so lets say 2 million accounts? $10 million+ advertisements etc. x 12 months.

120 million a year? - 500 employees averaging around 40k a year.

120 million - 20 million = 100 million to pay for servers, buildings, computers, electricity, water, food, events, etc.

What we should do… is everyone cancel membership for one month to see jagex reaction. “Oh shit all our members left, what we do?!?”

Read full topic

item.title: 84 Server crashed
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

LilXCj:

They are expanding their games which means they can’t afford using money to pay for the server (remember they’re a company, they have to pay for the stuff to keep staff, webservers, etc.) Even if they do have over 1 million active accounts, you have to wonder how much their building, staff, utilities, and maintenance cost.

Not 4 million dollars a month, which is what they claim to make in membership. I would imagine no where near that.

Read full topic

item.title: 84 Server crashed
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

[quote=“Spades, post:9, topic:380134”][quote author=LilXCj link=topic=475976.msg3480891#msg3480891 date=1296102492]

The world crashed today. I remember someone saying that runescape has only crashed twice.

Those were full out crashes, like all of runescape. A world crashing now is nothing new.

I wouldn’t call it a crash. JaGeX can no longer support the money it costs to uphold that server. Just like many of the other servers.
[/quote]

There is roughly 2 million account are members, being that there is said to be 10 million active accounts a mount pushing over 150 million made accounts. 2 million accounts being charged $6.00(USD) a month. That’s $4,000,000.00 each month the company is taking in, not to mention they most likely have a YouTube partnership and their Google ads, I promise you they have plenty of money, and then you have their recent vote which had 1.2 million views at least during the last month, which I guessed about they made $200,000 in that week alone. I doubt they can’t afford their servers. Their a multi-million dollar company.[/quote]

Don’t forget about them owning FunOrb also.

Read full topic

[quote=“Canownueazy, post:15, topic:380134”][quote author=xxlukexx link=topic=475976.msg3483667#msg3483667 date=1296368262]

If you really think 10M accounts are being used, there would be no point in the change name system.

And the recent vote pretty much tells you everything as people from old runescape probabily voted too.
[/quote]10M accs is nothing that’s idiocy

I had a server with 1M accs and it had 400-1200 online nowhere near RS’s[/quote]

Hi, I’m canownueazy and I post utter bullshit without proof. Oh and I suck dick.

item.title: 84 Server crashed
item.dc:creator: @_Rich Rich
item.description:
@_Rich wrote:

Think it was said a few weeks / months ago that they have over 200 million registered accounts, over 1 million members, and 3-6 million active accounts.

Of course, I don’t have a source but those numbers seem about right.

edit: I found where they said that close to 200 million accounts have been created:

Q. Why do you put a limit on the amount of bank space we can have?

A. There are technical limitations when it comes to saving the data on the server – remember that we have close to 200 million accounts with data saved, therefore some limitations are needed. Managing your bank has since become part of the everyday experience in RuneScape and we won’t take that away but we are always open for additional ideas as to store items.
Mod_fetzky


RuneScape

Join the discussion on the official RuneScape forum. Share your thoughts with the community, ask questions, find help, learn about events and much more.

[quote=“xxlukexx, post:11, topic:380134”][quote author=Spades link=topic=475976.msg3481422#msg3481422 date=1296170298]

The world crashed today. I remember someone saying that runescape has only crashed twice.

Those were full out crashes, like all of runescape. A world crashing now is nothing new.

I wouldn’t call it a crash. JaGeX can no longer support the money it costs to uphold that server. Just like many of the other servers.

There is roughly 2 million account are members, being that there is said to be 10 million active accounts a mount pushing over 150 million made accounts. 2 million accounts being charged $6.00(USD) a month. That’s $4,000,000.00 each month the company is taking in, not to mention they most likely have a YouTube partnership and their Google ads, I promise you they have plenty of money, and then you have their recent vote which had 1.2 million views at least during the last month, which I guessed about they made $200,000 in that week alone. I doubt they can’t afford their servers. Their a multi-million dollar company.
[/quote]

Part of that is complete bullshit.[/quote]

Prove me wrong.

item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

Someone is going to go to hell if that person stated that RuneScape crashed. That’s just a plain out lie to the people.

Speljohan:

RS used to be incredibly stable until they started with RT5 engine. Whilst it provides a lot of advantages, it causes a bunch of problems as well. It’s simply the price of using modern technology

This.
